com.xith3d.render
Class RenderOptions

java.lang.Object
  com.xith3d.render.RenderOptions
public class RenderOptions
extends Object

Storage class for configuring renderer options. Efficiency of this class is important to overall rendering time. All set and get opertaions are simple O(1) complexity operations which should not increase rendering time by a tracable margin. Constructors (and loading of default options or cloning RenderOptions using the loadOptions method) are O(n) operations but should only rarely be used. Import/Export methods are added for conveniance and have no time constraints.

Version:
1.0, 19th September 2003
Author:
William Denniss
See Also:
Option

Constructor Detail

RenderOptions

public RenderOptions()
Default constructor uses the default settings for all of the render options.

RenderOptions

public RenderOptions(RenderOptions base)
Creates a new RenderOptions class which mimmics the given RenderOptions.

Parameters:
base - The RenderOptions whose options will be cloned. If it is null then the default options are used.
Method Detail

setValue

public void setValue(Option key,
                     float value)
Sets the float value of the option. Normally only be used for non-boolean options but allowable for boolean ones.

Parameters:
key - The option to be set.
value - The new value of the option.

getValue

public float getValue(Option key)
Gets the float value of a Option. Normally only be used for non-boolean options but allowable for boolean ones.

Parameters:
key - the option who's value will be returned
Returns:
the value of the option

setOption

public void setOption(Option key,
                      boolean value)
Sets the boolean Option. Results may be unpredictable if this isn't a boolean option and a RuntimeException may be thrown in that case.

Parameters:
key - The option to be set.
value - The new value of the option.

getOption

public boolean getOption(Option key)
Gets the value of a boolean Option. Results may be unpredictable if this isn't a boolean option and a RuntimeException may be thrown in that case.

Parameters:
key - the option who's value will be returned
Returns:
the value of the option

loadDefaultOptions

public void loadDefaultOptions()
Loads the Xith3D default options.

loadOptions

public void loadOptions(RenderOptions renderOptions)
Reads the options from the passed RenderOptions and sets them in this RenderOptions.

Parameters:
renderOptions - The render options that will be cloned by this RenderOptions

exportOptions

public HashMap exportOptions()
Populates a HashMap with the options and their values. The values are mapped using their Option enum's name.

Returns:
populated HashMap with Option names mapped to their values

importOptions

public void importOptions(HashMap imported)
Sets all options from the given HashMap into the current RenderOptions object. The HashMap is interperated and the values are fed into the setValue methods. Hence, if a non-existant Option is used, a RuntimeException may be thrown.

Parameters:
imported - The options to import.
